entries.meaning: A warm cloth cap worn while sleeping, often with pajamas, being common attire in northern Europe before effective home heating became widespread. [From 14th c.]
examples: Winston wore a nightcap to stave off the cold.

entries.meaning: A beverage drunk before bed that is usually alcoholic. [From 1818.]
examples: I'll make myself a nightcap of whisky and lemon before heading to bed.

entries.meaning: (by extension, figuratively) Something that a person reads or listens to before bed.
examples: " […]  and as a nightcap I happened to pick the copy of Plato  […] "

entries.meaning: (US, sports, baseball) The final match of a sporting contest, especially the second game of a baseball doubleheader. [From 1939.]
(historical) A cap drawn over the face of the condemned person before they are hanged.

verbs.description: nightcap (third-person singular simple present nightcaps, present participle nightcapping, simple past and past participle nightcapped)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To drink an alcoholic beverage shortly before retiring to bed.
examples: Even better than breakfast, though, is nightcapping at the Waffle House . Nightcapping happens after the bars close, but before the southern sunrise: the hours when their jukeboxes play “Freebird” on a continual loop,  […]
